module.name: connectivity_allocation_to_physical_network
module.name.french: Attribution de connectivité au réseau physique
module.keywords: module, functional network, allocation, physical node, routing, auto-router, network, hierarchy, node

abstract.p: the representation of allocating a set of connected functional network nodes of a hierarchical network to the physical node that is to be realised within an interconnect substrate. The node in the interconnect substrate establishes the basic requirement for routing the connections of an interconnect substrate, either manually or by an auto-router.
abstract.li: the allocation of a collection of functional network nodes to a single physical network node of an interconnect module.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of allocating a set of connected functional network nodes of a hierarchical network to the physical node that is to be realised within an interconnect substrate. The node in the interconnect substrate establishes the basic requirement for routing the connections of an interconnect substrate, either manually or by an auto-router.
purpose.note: For compatibility with other industry standards forms of the term 'physical network' is used in this part of ISO 10303 to represent the physical node in the interconnect substrate.

The physical node in the interconnect substrate is an abstract concept and is itself not founded in a geometric context. The physical node is the lowest level of abstraction at which a node is considered as a single concept. The next lower level of detail in this part of ISO 10303 subdivides the physical node into the various implementation details in the layout.

inscope.li: the allocation of a collection of functional network nodes to a single physical network node of an interconnect module;
items within the scope of application module Functional decomposition with nodal representation to packaged mapping, ISO/TS 10303-1678;
items within the scope of application module Layered interconnect module design, ISO/TS 10303-1698.

outscope.li: the relationships among allocations of multiple functional network nodes.
